data.title: Family Farm Sonneboedeli Escholzmatt
data.meta_description: SUNNY-Bodeli, a family farm run by Franz and Renate Muff-Müller, lies above Escholzmatt in the UNESCO Entlebuch biosphere reserve.
data.text:
1,100 meters above sea level, between Bern and Lucerne in the heart of Switzerland, there is a place, just outside from Escholzmatt called SONNE-Bodeli where one can find peace and relaxation.

Originally the places name is Boedeli, but due it`s sunny location the farm run by Franz and Renata Muff-Müller is lovingly beeing called SONNE-Boedeli and belongs to the UNESCO Entlebuch biosphere reserve. The area is a nature, hiking and biking paradise with both summer and winter activities. From the farm one can see the mountain tops of Schrattenfluh, Beichle, Marbachegg, Eiger, Mönch and Jungfrau.

One of the highlights of the farm are the impressive sunrises, in all its variations. From summer to winter and back again, the hilly landscape, with often clear mountain views, invites you to come, relax and explore.

Activities

Culinary delights are also on offer, from gourmet to regional cuisine. The well-known Kemmeribodenbad, a gourmet restaurant in the wild countryside, or the Restaurant Rössli in Escholzmatt, where you can simply enjoy the “Hexer” with its traditional cuisine. If you like Asian food, the Chinese and Thai restaurant in Schüpfheim has something interesting to offer. Many exciting excursion destinations can be reached by train or bus. Within a radius of 30 km is also the hiking and biking area of Sörenberg with its spectacular moorland, the Brienzer Rothhorn and other mountain peaks with breathtaking panoramas, the toboggan run and the rope park. So there is plenty of variety from spring to autumn.

You can find out more about the region and its activities at Biosphaere Entlebuch.

Location
